researchMasterList.report: Unveiling the Strategic Impact of AI Orchestration on Business Processes and Beyond
researchMasterList.description:
Market Insight Research by Quadrant Knowledge Solutions delves into the pivotal role of AI Orchestration in empowering organizations to swiftly adapt to fluctuating market conditions, evolving customer demands, or regulatory requirements. Process orchestration entails coordinating, synchronizing, and monitoring multiple automated workflows within an organization. This methodology ensures the seamless operation of workflows and guarantees the desired outcomes of each process. AI orchestration helps enterprises streamline processes, improve decision-making, enhance customer experiences, and ultimately drive business growth and competitiveness in an increasingly digital and data-driven business environment.

Key Highlights of this Market Insight: 

  • Examine how AI orchestration streamlines business processes by identifying inefficiencies and optimization opportunities across workflows. 
  • Delve into why AI orchestration is essential for organizations embarking on digital transformation journeys. 
  • Highlight the significance of integrating AI and ML into organizational processes and the need for data-driven insights to minimize errors, reduce waste, and optimize resource utilization.  
  • Explore the benefits of an AI orchestration framework, such as AI plugins, workflow design, collaboration, and communication.
  • Gain insights into the future of AI orchestration, including intelligent process orchestration, automated process discovery, the influence of generative AI, and human-centric bpm.
  • Learn about the challenges addressed by AI orchestration, including breaking the silos and dependencies between different teams, tools, models, and frameworks and fostering collaboration and innovation. 
  • Discover current use cases served by vendors, including medical imaging analysis, resume screening, and monitoring of transactions. 

Arun U, an analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions, defines AI orchestration as the strategic coordination of multiple AI elements, algorithms, and processes within a system or platform to achieve specific goals efficiently inside a single framework. Organizations can reach unprecedented levels of business process optimization by implementing a systematic approach that includes data processing, model training, deployment, and continuing monitoring of AI synergies. 

This Market Insight is a part of Quadrant’s Business Process Automation practice.   

Authors: Arun U , Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions.

Kunal Pakhale , Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions.

Apoorva Dawalbhakta , Associate Director at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions.
researchMasterList.author: Arun U

researchMasterList.report: Identity Theft and Fraud: How Advanced Verification Technologies are Combating Digital Identity Crime
researchMasterList.description:
Quadrant Knowledge Solutions' latest market insight, “Identity Theft and Fraud: How Advanced Verification Technologies are Combating Digital Identity Crime”, delves deep into the mitigation of fraud incidents and potential identity thefts. In the past few years, the identity verification sector has seen remarkable expansion, driven by new market entrants aiming to entice a broader user base through user-friendly innovations and advancements in digital identity verification. This surge has led to the availability of more affordable, simplified, and convenient verification and authentication processes.

In the ongoing battle against fraud and identity theft, platforms are continuously adapting to evolving fraud patterns and anomalies within the verification process. This proactive approach significantly enhances the accuracy and effectiveness of verification measures.

Table of Contents:

  • Introduction
  • Market Expansion
  • Benefits for Customers and Vendors
  • Future Trends
  • Conclusion

This Market Insight is a part of Quadrant’s Financial Crime and Compliance Studies.

Author:  Divya Baranawal, Vice President and Principal Analyst

                Yashi Saxena , Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions.
researchMasterList.author: Yashi Saxena

researchMasterList.report: SPARK Matrix™: Global Marketing Agencies, Q1 2024
researchMasterList.description:
Digital technology has changed the face of businesses and forced organizations to realize the importance of deep customer engagement and understanding and analyzing the customers’ intentions and preferences. The need to effectively connect with new and existing customers in a complex ecosystem with an infinite number of engagement channels and touchpoints has become more important than ever. The pandemic compelled organizations to reconsider their involvement with marketing agencies and other service providers in order to achieve their business goals. As the pandemic pushed a major transformation in customer behavior, organizations turned to marketing agencies to pivot quickly by creating media strategies and unique digital experiences. These agencies are also increasingly adopting remote-work flexibility models and are creating ways to maximize response and delivery for clients and their marketing initiatives. The marketing agencies play a major role in helping organizations to develop and execute innovative customer experiences and strategically align with the value of the business.

Quadrant Knowledge Solutions defines Global Marketing Agencies (GMA) as service providers who help brands to formulate and execute their marketing strategies. GMAs offer strategic marketing services and a broad range of other complementary services that enable brands to improve their customers journeys across various digital channels and touchpoints. These agencies take a data driven approach to help brands optimize their marketing strategies, improve brand advocacy and drive awareness.

The research includes detailed competition analysis and vendor evaluation with the proprietary SPARK Matrix analysis. SPARK Matrix includes the ranking and positioning of leading Global Marketing Agencies with a global impact. This research study includes an analysis of various key vendors, including Accenture Song, AKQA, Deloitte Digital, Dentsu Creative, Digitas, Havas,Huge, iCrossing, IPG, Media.Monks, Merkle, MRM, Omnicom Group, Publicis Groupe, RAPP, R/GA, Stagwell, VML, Wipro Digital and WPP.

According to Manakh Phukon, Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions, “Global Marketing Agencies are heading towards a future defined by digitization, creativity, innovation, and strategic prowess. These agencies have started assisting businesses in deeply committing to cultural authenticity by deploying marketing strategies that involve crafting and delivering narratives that highly resonate with diverse cultural needs. By leveraging the powerful features of AI-based technologies, these agencies allow businesses to quickly adapt their marketing campaigns based on emerging data and respond to changing market preferences.”

researchMasterList.report: SPARK Matrix™: Cloud Database Management Systems, Q1 2024
researchMasterList.description:
Quadrant Knowledge Solutions Cloud Database Management Systems (CDBMS) market research includes a detailed global analysis of major vendors. The research comprises of vendors’ product features and functionalities, as well as competitive differentiating factors. The research provides competitive landscape and vendor analysis to enable service vendors to enhance their understanding of the market and implement a growth-oriented technology roadmap.

The research includes detailed competition analysis and vendor evaluation with the proprietary SPARK Matrix analysis. The SPARK Matrix includes ranking and positioning of the leading Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) vendors with a global impact, including Aerospike, Aiven, Alibaba Cloud, AWS, Cloudera, Cockroach Labs, Couchbase, Databricks, DataStax, EDB, Exasol, Google, Huawei Cloud, IBM, InfluxData, InterSystems, MariaDB, MarkLogic, Microsoft, MongoDB, Neo4j, OpenText, Oracle, Redis Labs, SAP, SingleStore, Snowflake, Tencent Cloud, Teradata, TigerGraph, and Yellowbrick Data.

According to Abhishek Anant Garg, Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions, “Cloud Database Management Systems (CDBMS) enables concurrent user access, manipulate, & extract data from scalable cloud databases compatible with high-level and database specific programming languages. Compared with conventional databases, CDBMS operates on a shared database model providing computing as a Service and facilitates enhanced power & design, and exhibits superior qualities in handling data & process volumes compared to its counterpart. The existing competitive landscape of vendors is strategizing on the integration of AI-ML-empowered self-driving & intelligent databases, to reduce latency and enhance scalability & ability for anomaly elimination ”

According to Nikhilesh Naik, Principal Industry Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions, “Cloud Database Management Systems (CDBMS) empower its users to resolve their queries related to cloud-hosted storage by facilitating offerings for seamless setup, maintenance, enhancement, modification, & utilization of database hosted in the cloud. To address the evolving requirements of enterprises, automation of database administration for ensuring optimal uptime & enhancing real-time performance insights is a priority roadmap of vendors operating in this market. Additionally, the adoption of serverless architecture, growing emphasis on solutions optimized for public cloud platforms, by leveraging native services, and the presence of built-in security features have improved demand for CDBMS.”

2024 Cloud Database Management Systems SPARK Matrix

Source: Quadrant Knowledge Solutions

researchMasterList.description:
Quadrant knowledge solutions Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) market research includes a detailed global analysis of major vendors. The research comprises of vendors’ product features and functionalities, as well as competitive differentiating factors. The research provides competitive landscape and vendor analysis to enable service vendors to enhance their understanding of the market and implement a growth-oriented technology roadmap.

The research includes detailed competition analysis and vendor evaluation with the proprietary SPARK Matrix analysis. The SPARK Matrix includes ranking and positioning of the leading Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) vendors with a global impact, including Amazon, Alibaba, DigitalOcean, Google, Huawei, Microsoft, Netlify, Oracle, Tencent, Vercel.

According to Sitaparna Roy, Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions adds, “Function-as-a-Service (FaaS), is a cloud computing service that enables developers to create, execute, and manage discrete units of code as individual functions, without the need to oversee the underlying infrastructure. This approach enables developers to focus solely on writing code for their application's specific functions, abstracting away the complexities of infrastructure management associated with developing and deploying microservices applications. With FaaS, developers can write and update small, modular pieces of code, which are designed to respond to specific events or triggers. FaaS is commonly used for building microservices, real-time data processing, and automating workflows. It decreases much of the infrastructure management complexity, making it easier for developers to focus on writing code and delivering functionality. FaaS can power the backend for mobile applications, handling user authentication, data synchronization, and push notifications, among other functions.”

According to Nikhilesh Naik, Principal Industry Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions “Function as a Service (FaaS) platforms provide a streamlined and agile development environment, allowing developers to concentrate on coding and innovation rather than infrastructure concerns. The technology’s ability to offer cost-efficiency, automatic scaling, resource abstraction, and event-driven architecture has made FaaS an essential factor for modern application development. Highlighting factors such as the compelling need for cost-efficient, scalable, & streamlined approach to application development & deployment, increasing shift from DevOps to serverless, and high growth in cloud-based services are propelling the adoption of FaaS Platforms.”

2024 Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) SPARK Matrix

researchMasterList.report: Leveraging Process Mining for Further Catalyzing Sustainability Agendas
researchMasterList.description:
Quadrant Knowledge Solutions’ Market Insight Research delves into the pivotal role of process mining technology in facilitating organizations to attain sustainability objectives amid growing corporate sustainability initiatives. Process mining provides valuable capabilities to optimize workflows, reduce waste, and track emissions to improve environmental impact. The detailed insights unlocked by process mining into the actual execution of work enable businesses to enhance operational efficiency and support data-driven decision-making, which are essential components for digital transformation and smart manufacturing which, in turn, will foster sustainability initiatives.

Key Highlights of this Market Insight:

  • Examination of how process mining enhances sustainability efforts by identifying inefficiencies and optimization opportunities across workflows.
  • Explanation of why process mining is essential for organizations seeking sustainability goals.
  • Highlighting the significance of integrating sustainability into organizational processes and the need for data-driven insights to minimize waste and resource usage.
  • Understanding current applications of process mining in sustainability, such as analyzing material flows for closed-loop recycling and waste reduction.
  • Gaining insights into the future of process mining in sustainability, including its potential to drive transformative advantages and enhance environmental impact assessments.
  • Discussion of challenges in implementing process mining for sustainability, such as data quality issues and motivating behavior change.
  • Discovering current use cases served by vendors, including analyzing transportation data to measure carbon emissions and assessing supplier sustainability on Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics.

According to Anoch Mane, an analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions, process mining plays an integral role in driving sustainability efforts by offering unparalleled visibility into organizational workflows. It not only helps improve operational efficiency but also enables the identification of opportunities for optimizing resource usage and reducing waste across processes. The capability of process mining to deliver real-time process insights and enable continuous improvement positions it as an essential component of modern corporate sustainability programs within the current business landscape.

This Market Insight is a part of Quadrant Knowledge Solutions’ Business Process Automation practice. 

Authors: Anoch Mane , Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions

Pranjal Singh , Principal Industry Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions

Apoorva Dawalbhakta , Associate Director at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions
researchMasterList.author: Anoch Mane

researchMasterList.report: SPARK Matrix™: Customer Communication Management, Q1,2024
researchMasterList.description:
Quadrant Knowledge Solutions defines customer communication management (CCM) as a platform that enables organizations to efficiently create, manage, and deliver personalized and consistent communications across various channels throughout the customer lifecycle. It integrates multiple communication channels, such as print, email, SMS, and web, into a centralized system, helping businesses streamline the creation and distribution of customer-facing documents, messages, and interactions. The key objectives of a CCM platform are to enhance the customer experience, ensure regulatory compliance, and optimize communication processes by providing a unified and automated approach to managing customer communications.

CCM platforms have become widely adopted due to the expansion of digital channels and rising customer expectations for a seamless experience throughout the customer lifecycle journey. Recently, it has become crucial to enhance the customer experience at every stage of the customer lifecycle. Therefore, organizations are focusing on becoming more customer-centric, hence the need for customer communication management. A CCM platform is essential for providing a continuous flow of information throughout the customer lifecycle, as it aids in management communication across various channels while maintaining and enhancing user retention and loyalty.

Personalized communication has taken center stage with more and more businesses trying to reach customers at all possible touchpoints. The personalized communication approach fosters customer satisfaction and loyalty, positively impacting customer retention and revenue generation. Users should have access to the information of their interests anywhere, anytime, using any device or operating system, and in the language they are most comfortable with. They should have complete control over the kind of data displayed and the way it is displayed. A customized communication channel and experience grant customers maximum control over communication and information management.

The market direction for CCM is propelled by a growing demand for enhanced customer experiences, increased regulatory requirements, and a shift toward digital transformation. Organizations are increasingly investing in CCM solutions to streamline communication processes across various channels and offer personalized interactions. The rise of omnichannel communication, coupled with a focus on customer-centric strategies, is steering the market toward solutions that seamlessly integrate with diverse platforms. Additionally, the need for compliance with stringent regulations and standards is a significant driver, prompting businesses to adopt CCM platforms that ensure secure and regulated communication practices. As the market evolves, factors such as data-driven insights, AI integration, and scalability are becoming key drivers influencing the direction of CCM solutions.

Digital trust services have emerged as a prominent trend in the CCM market, reflecting the increasing importance of secure and reliable interactions in the digital era. Organizations are prioritizing solutions that enhance trust by incorporating features such as e-signatures, secure document exchange, and identity verification within their communication platforms. This trend is driven by a growing need for businesses to ensure the integrity and authenticity of their digital communications, fostering a sense of trust among customers, partners, and stakeholders. As the CCM landscape evolves, the integration of digital trust services is becoming a key differentiator for companies seeking to establish and maintain credibility in their online interactions.

The research includes detailed competition analysis and vendor evaluation with the proprietary SPARK Matrix analysis. SPARK Matrix includes the ranking and positioning of leading customer communication management vendors with a global impact. This study includes an analysis of key vendors, such as Adobe, Compart, Conga, CSG, Doxee, Doxim, FCI-CCM, Intense Technologies, Messagepoint, MHC Automation, Newgen, Nintex, OpenText, Oracle, Precisely, Quadient, Sefas, and Smart Communications.

According to Saurabh Raj, Analyst at Quadrant Knowledge Solutions, " Implementing a CCM platform offers significant business benefits by optimizing operational workflows and delivering a more tailored customer experience. The platform's integration of communication channels, including print, email, SMS, and web, enhances operational efficiency, reduces manual intervention, and minimizes the risk of errors. Improved resource utilization and streamlined document creation contribute to operational efficiency. The platform's automation capabilities ensure consistency in messaging and facilitate compliance with regulatory standards, mitigating legal and financial risks. It helps enhance the customer experience by promptly managing communication throughout all interactions.”
